qas.question: What languages have a tendency to lose gender-invariable adjectives?
What is ab example of a gender marked adjective?
What would be the traditional form of a gender-invariable adjective?

context: There is a tendency to abandon traditionally gender-invariable adjectives in favour of marked ones, something prevalent in <a0_0>Occitan and French<a0_0/>. Thus, one can find <a1_0><a2_0>bullent/bullenta<a2_0/><a1_0/> ("boiling") in contrast with traditional bullent/bullent.
